note.p: Birth: Wolfisheim, near Strasbourg, France (26 November 1817)
Career: Studied chemistry under Liebig, at Giessen; Assistant to J B A Dumas, Ecole de Medicine, Paris (1845); Professor of Organic Chemistry, Faculte de medecine, Paris (1853); Senator (1881)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1884-1885 vol 38 pp xxiii-xxxiv signed by A W W
References: Sir Harold Hartley, 'Stanislao Cannizzaro, FRS (1826-1910) and the First International Chemical Conference at Karlsruhe in 1860' in NR 1966 vol 21 pp 56-63
